titleStmt.title: Thaddeus K. Wetmore to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2302

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
St Louis Nov 3d 1865
To His Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky
Frankfort
(Ky.)
Dear Sir,
I make application to your Excellency for the appointment of Commissioner of Deeds for Kentucky.

In making the application I would state that I am the son of the late Maj Wetmore who lost his right arm in 1812 & brother of the late Capt Leonidas Wetmore who fought in the Florida & Mexican Wars and I served in the present rebellion against the Rebels under Col Gilbert 71 Illinois Volunteers

I would be pleased
to receive the appointment. I am Notary Public and Commr of deeds for Illinois and having frequent applications to take acknowledgements for your state it is necessary for me to have the Commission.

I am very Respectfuly
Your Obt Servt
Thaddeus K. Wetmore

Comr of Deeds
Missouri
Thaddeus K Wetmore
comd 6th Nov/1865
